text: Wilbert "Bill" Hunt (22 Aug 1890 Connersville, Indiana - December 15, 1950 Wickenburg, Arizona) was an American racecar driver active during the formative years of the auto racing. Better known for running the Craig-Hunt engine manufacturing company, that also made racing and road parts. Later became an aviator and rancher, but remained close to engineering all his life. Despite numerous reports listing him as William, his first name was Wilbert.http://www.oldracingcars.com/driver/Bill_Hunt ==Career statistics== ===By season=== {|class="wikitable" !Season !Class !Team !Race !Win !Podium !Pole !FLap !Pts !Plcd |- align="right" ! 1924 | AAA National Championship | Barber-Warnock | 1 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | NC |- align="right" |} ==Indy 500 results== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Year !Car !Start !Qual !Rank !Finish !Laps !Led !Retired |- !1924 |26 |19 |85.040 |21 |14 |191 |0 |Flagged |- |} {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Starts |1 |- !Poles |0 |- !Front Row |0 |- !Wins |0 |- !Top 5 |0 |- !Top 10 |0 |- !Retired |0 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Indianapolis 500 drivers Category:1890 births Category:1950 deaths Category:Racing drivers from Indiana Category:Sportspeople from Indianapolis Category:People from Wickenburg, Arizona Category:People from Connersville, Indiana Category:Sportspeople from the Phoenix metropolitan area
